maml:description.maml:para: Open the current profile script in Notepad.
The Edit-Profile cmdlet opens the current profile script in Notepad.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example opens the current profile script in Notepad.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of Exception classes available from the currently loaded assemblies.
The Get-AvailableExceptionsList scans each loaded assembly for class names that end with the word Exception.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AvailableExceptionsList
Microsoft.CSharp.RuntimeBinder.RuntimeBinderException Microsoft.CSharp.RuntimeBinder.RuntimeBinderInternalCompilerException Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.CimException Microsoft.PowerShell.Cmdletization.Cim.CimJobException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.CertificateNotFoundException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.CertificateProviderItemNotFoundException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.CertificateStoreLocationNotFoundException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.CertificateStoreNotFoundException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.HelpCategoryInvalidException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.HelpNotFoundException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.HttpResponseException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ProcessCommandException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.RestartComputerTimeoutException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ServiceCommandException Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.WriteErrorException Microsoft.PowerShell.CrossCompatibility.CompatibilityAnalysisException Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileIO.MalformedLineException Newtonsoft.Json.JsonException Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReaderException Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializationException Newtonsoft.Json.JsonWriterException Newtonsoft.Json.Schema.JsonSchemaException System.AccessViolationException System.AggregateException System.AppDomainUnloadedException System.ApplicationException System.ArgumentException System.ArgumentNullException System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException System.ArithmeticException System.ArrayTypeMismatchException System.BadImageFormatException
...
System.Threading.ThreadAbortException System.Threading.ThreadInterruptedException System.Threading.ThreadStartException System.Threading.ThreadStateException System.Threading.WaitHandleCannotBeOpenedException System.TimeoutException System.TimeZoneNotFoundException System.TypeAccessException System.TypeInitializationException System.TypeLoadException System.TypeUnloadedException System.UnauthorizedAccessException System.UriFormatException System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaException System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaInferenceException System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaValidationException System.Xml.XmlException System.Xml.XPath.XPathException System.Xml.Xsl.XsltCompileException System.Xml.Xsl.XsltException

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns the current available exception types.

maml:description.maml:para: Return the elapsed time of the last command.
The Get-LastExecutionTime cmdlet returns the elapsed time of the last command executed.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-LastExecutionTime
Days : 0 Hours : 0 Minutes : 0 Seconds : 1 Milliseconds : 716 Ticks : 17161638 TotalDays : 1.98630069444444E-05 TotalHours : 0.000476712166666667 TotalMinutes : 0.02860273 TotalSeconds : 1.7161638 TotalMilliseconds : 1716.1638

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns the elapsed time of the last command.

maml:description.maml:para: Return a list of Approved Powershell Verbs.
The Get-PowershellVerbs returns the list of approved verbs in the current Powershell session.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PowershellVerbs
Verb AliasPrefix Group Description ---- ----------- ----- ----------- Add a Common Adds a resource to a container, or attaches an item to another item Approve ap Lifecycle Confirms or agrees to the status of a resource or process Assert as Lifecycle Affirms the state of a resource Backup ba Data Stores data by replicating it Block bl Security Restricts access to a resource Build bd Lifecycle Creates an artifact (usually a binary or document) out of some set of input files (usually s… Checkpoint ch Data Creates a snapshot of the current state of the data or of its configuration Clear cl Common Removes all the resources from a container but does not delete the container Close cs Common Changes the state of a resource to make it inaccessible, unavailable, or unusable Compare cr Data Evaluates the data from one resource against the data from another resource Complete cmp Lifecycle Concludes an operation
...
Use u Other Uses or includes a resource to do something Wait w Lifecycle Pauses an operation until a specified event occurs Watch wc Common Continually inspects or monitors a resource for changes Write wr Communications Adds information to a target

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows the current approved verbs that can be used for Powershell cmdlets.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the contents of the currently loaded profile script.
The Get-Profile cmdlet returns the contents of the currently loaded profile script.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows the contents of the currently loaded profile script.

maml:description.maml:para: Import a .Net Assembly.
The Import-Assembly imports a .Net assembly based on the name of the assembly file or the name of assembly if loading from GAC.
Specifies the name of the assembly file or the name of assembly if loading from GAC.
Specifies the name of the assembly file or the name of assembly if loading from GAC.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example imports the System.Text assembly from the GAC.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new Error Record.
The New-ErrorRecord cmdlet wraps an exception into a Powershell Error Record.
An Exception describing the error.
String which uniquely identifies this error condition.
Information regarding the ErrorCategory associated with this error, and with the categorized error message for that ErrorCategory.
This is the object against which the cmdlet or provider was operating when the error occurred. This is optional.
The message that describes the current exception.
String which uniquely identifies this error condition.
Human-readable text that describes the error.
Information regarding the ErrorCategory associated with this error, and with the categorized error message for that ErrorCategory.
This is the object against which the cmdlet or provider was operating when the error occurred. This is optional.
The Exception instance that caused the current exception.
Information regarding the ErrorCategory associated with this error, and with the categorized error message for that ErrorCategory.
String which uniquely identifies this error condition.
An Exception describing the error.
Human-readable text that describes the error.
The Exception instance that caused the current exception.
The message that describes the current exception.
This is the object against which the cmdlet or provider was operating when the error occurred. This is optional.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-ErrorRecord -Message "New Error Record" -ExceptionType "System.Exception" -ErrorId "EX01" -ErrorCategory NotSpecified
New Error Record + CategoryInfo : NotSpecified: (:) [], Exception + FullyQualifiedErrorId : EX01

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example produces a new error record based on the message provided.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-ErrorRecord -Exception $(New-Object System.Exception) -ErrorId "4567" -ErrorCategory NotSpecified
Exception of type 'System.Exception' was thrown. + CategoryInfo : NotSpecified: (:) [], Exception + FullyQualifiedErrorId : 4567

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example produces a new error record base on the exception provided.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove Powershell aliases from a script file.
The Remove-AliasesFromScript allows you to quickly create a Powershell script containing aliases and then remove them and replace them with the cmdlet names.
Specifies a path to a Powershell script file.
Specifies a path to a Powershell script file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Remove-AliasesFromScript -Path test1.ps1
Replacing 'gci' with 'Get-ChildItem'... Replacing '%' with 'ForEach-Object'...

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example replaces any Powershell aliases with their equivalent Powershell command.

maml:description.maml:para: Unload a Powershell module loaded into the current session.
The Reset-Module command unloads a module if it is loaded within the current Powershell session.
Specifies the name of the module.
Specifies the name of the module.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example unloads the Powershell module if it is loaded.

maml:description.maml:para: Import a Powershell module after unloading it if it is loaded.
The Restart-Module cmdlet will unload a Powershell module with the same name before attempting to import the specified module.
Specifies the name of the module.
Specifies the name of the module.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will unload the module, if loaded, before importing the module.

maml:description.maml:para: Display a list of matching commands.
The Search-Command cmdlet will search for a command that matches a filter. Sometimes it is helpful to search for a part of a cmdlet's name when you can't remember the exact spelling of the cmdlet.
Specify a filter to look for.
Specify a filter to look for.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Search-Command -Filter "Assert-"
Name Version Source ---- ------- ------ Assert-Elevation 0.0 Elevation Assert-MockCalled 3.4.0 Pester Assert-PSRule 1.11.0 PSRule Assert-VerifiableMocks 3.4.0 Pester

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows all available commands that start with 'Assert-'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Search-Command -Filter "container"
Name Version Source ---- ------- ------ Add-AppProvisionedSharedPackageContainer 3.0 Dism Add-AppSharedPackageContainer 2.0.1.0 Appx Add-ProvisionedAppSharedPackageContainer 3.0 Dism Get-AppProvisionedSharedPackageContainer 3.0 Dism Get-AppSharedPackageContainer 2.0.1.0 Appx Get-ProvisionedAppSharedPackageContainer 3.0 Dism Get-PveContainerStatus 0.0 Proxmox New-HTMLContainer 0.0.164 PSWriteHTML Remove-AppProvisionedSharedPackageContainer 3.0 Dism Remove-AppSharedPackageContainer 2.0.1.0 Appx Remove-ProvisionedAppSharedPackageContainer 3.0 Dism Reset-AppSharedPackageContainer 2.0.1.0 Appx

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows all available commands that contain the word 'container'.

maml:description.maml:para: Test if the current Powershell session is non-interactive.
The Test-IsNonInteractive cmdlet will test if the powershell session is non-interactive or launched as a interactive process.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns false when executed from a Powershell console host.

maml:description.maml:para: Test if a verb is an approved Powershell verb.

The Test-PowershellVerb is a way to test if the specified verb is on the approved list. While Powershell doesn't prevent someone from using a non-approved verb in cmdlets, it does generate warnings when imported.
Specifies the name of the Powershell verb to test.
Specifies the name of the Powershell verb to test.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns true because 'get' is an approved Powershell verb.
This example returns false because 'unload' is not an approved Powershell verb.

maml:description.maml:para: Update all modules that can be updated.
The Update-AllModules wraps Update-InstalledModules and Update-MyModules to update all available modules that can be updated.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Update-AllModules
Updating third-party Powershell modules...
Updating my Powershell modules...

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example updated both installed modules and my modules.

maml:description.maml:para: Update, if available, modules installed via a repository.
The Update-InstalledModules cmdlet updates modules installed via a repository. If an update is not available, nothing is done.
Displays detailed information about the operation done by the command. This information resembles the information in a trace or in a transaction log.
Displays detailed information about the operation done by the command. This information resembles the information in a trace or in a transaction log.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example updates all of the installed modules.

maml:description.maml:para: Download and update my modules.
The Update-MyModules cmdlet downloads and replaces my modules directory in my user profile directory. It removes any "published" modules so they aren't duplicated.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example downloads and replaces my modules directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Download and update my profile scripts.
The Update-MyProfile cmdlet downloads and replaces my profile scripts in my user profile directory. It then reloads the profile script for the current host.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example downloads and replaces my profile scripts.

maml:description.maml:para: Update the list of my published modules and install or update them.
The Update-MyPublishedModules cmdlet will download the lastest list of my published modules from my chocolatey repository and then install or update any modules in that list.
Displays detailed information about the operation done by the command. This information resembles the information in a trace or in a transaction log.
Displays detailed information about the operation done by the command. This information resembles the information in a trace or in a transaction log.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example downloads the latest list and installs or updates them.

maml:description.maml:para: Update the list of installed third-party modules and install or update them.
The Update-MyThirdPartyModules cmdlet will download the lastest list of third-party modules from my chocolatey repository and then install or update any modules in that list.
Displays detailed information about the operation done by the command. This information resembles the information in a trace or in a transaction log.
Displays detailed information about the operation done by the command. This information resembles the information in a trace or in a transaction log.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example downloads the latest list and installs or updates them.

maml:description.maml:para: Update all of the pre-compiled assemblies.
The Update-PreCompiledAssemblies cmdlet gathers all of the loaded assemblies and runs ngen.exe on each.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Update-PreCompiledAssemblies Ensuring all currently loaded runtime assemblies are pre-compiled...
Running ngen.exe on 'mscorlib.dll'... All compilation targets are up to date.
Running ngen.exe on 'Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost.dll'... All compilation targets are up to date.
Running ngen.exe on 'System.dll'... All compilation targets are up to date.
Running ngen.exe on 'System.Core.dll'... All compilation targets are up to date.
...
Running ngen.exe on 'Windows.Security.winmd'... All compilation targets are up to date.
Running ngen.exe on 'Microsoft.HostCompute.PowerShell.Cmdlets.dll'... 2> Compiling assembly Microsoft.HostCompute.PowerShell.Views, Version=10.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35 (CLR v4.0.30319) ... 1> Compiling assembly C:\Windows\Microsoft.Net\assembly\GAC_64\Microsoft.HostCompute.PowerShell.Cmdlets\v4.0_10.0.0.0__31bf3856ad364e35\Microsoft.HostCompute.PowerShell.Cmdlets.dll (CLR v4.0.30319) ... 1> Compiling assembly Microsoft.HostCompute.Interop, Version=10.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35 (CLR v4.0.30319) ...
Running ngen.exe on 'Microsoft.CertificateServices.PKIClient.Cmdlets.dll'... All compilation targets are up to date.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example updates all of the loaded assemblies pre-compile.

maml:description.maml:para: Reload the profile script.
The Update-Profile cmdlet reloads the profile script into the current session.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example reloads the profile script in the current session.
